message.content: Penstemon barbatus is a herbaceous perennial plant that belongs to the family Plantaginaceae. It is commonly known as the beardtongue. This plant has tall spikes of trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of red, pink, and purple. The flowers have five lobes and a prominent stamen that extends beyond the flower. The leaves of the Penstemon barbatus are opposite, simple, and lance-shaped with saw-toothed edges. This plant can be found in mountain meadows, stream banks, and open woodlands across North America. It is commonly grown in gardens and used as a cut flower for flower arrangements. The Penstemon barbatus is known for attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds, bees, and butterflies due to its long blooming period.
